overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Vision.

First, install @google-cloud/vision with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/vision

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/visionâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var vision = require('@google-cloud/vision')();

Elsewhere

var vision = require('@google-cloud/vision')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/vision are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: ImageAnnotatorClient
methods.description:
Service that performs Google Cloud Vision API detection tasks over client images, such as face, landmark, logo, label, and text detection. The ImageAnnotator service returns detected entities from the images.

This will be created through a builder function which can be obtained by the module. See the following example of how to initialize the module and how to access to the builder.

methods.name: getProjectId
methods.description: Get the project ID used by this class.

params.name: callback
params.description: • the callback to be called with the current project Id.

methods.name: batchAnnotateImages
methods.description: Run image detection and annotation for a batch of images.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.requests
params.description:
Individual image annotation requests for this batch.

This object should have the same structure as AnnotateImageRequest

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing BatchAnnotateImagesResponse.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing BatchAnnotateImagesResponse. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

params.name: opts.servicePath
params.description: The domain name of the API remote host.

params.name: opts.port
params.description: The port on which to connect to the remote host.

params.name: opts.sslCreds
params.description: A ClientCredentials for use with an SSL-enabled channel.

params.name: opts.clientConfig
params.description: The customized config to build the call settings. See {@link gax.constructSettings} for the format.
